form.prompt: Key similar examples from your language, whether or not fronting is required, here:

radioGroup.prompt: Is an interrogative phrase required to be fronted in content questions in your language?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, like English
No, it simply remains in place

radioGroup.prompt: In main clause content questions, are there one or more special question marker particles or complementizers that may occur in addition to the interrogative phrases?
radioGroup.radio: Yes

radioGroup.prompt: Is it written as a separate word?
radioGroup.radio: No, it is a clitic which attaches to another word

radioGroup.prompt: Is the clitic a pro-clitic or a post-clitic?
radioGroup.radio: A pro-clitic or prefix
A post-clitic or suffix
Some of each type

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the clitic attach to the question?
radioGroup.radio: At the edge

radio.span: Between the fronted interrogative phrase and the rest of the question

radioGroup.radio: To the verb
Yes

radioGroup.prompt: Do any of these question markers occur before a fronted interrogative phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, all the question markers occur immediately after any fronted interrogative phrase
No, all the question markers occur either immediately after any fronted interrogative phrase or at the end of the question

radioGroup.prompt: Can all the question markers appear in either position?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, there is no restriction
No, there are separate sets for each position
Yes, all occur before a fronted interrogative phrase
Yes, some occur before a fronted interrogative phrase but some occur after it

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the question marker occur with respect to the rest of the question (other than a fronted interrogative phrase)?
radioGroup.radio: Before
After
Either side, but not on both sides at the same time
On either side, or on both sides at the same time
Before it, or on both sides at the same time
After it, or on both sides at the same time
Only on both sides at the same time

radioGroup.prompt: Can all the question markers appear on either side of the question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, there is no restriction
No, there are separate sets for each side

radioGroup.prompt: Is a question marker required in every content question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes
No, some content questions do not use/need the question marker
No, but an auxiliary is fronted, like in English

radioGroup.prompt: Is an auxiliary required to be fronted in every content question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes
No, some content questions do not require a fronted auxiliary, such as content questions which question the subject in English
No, there is no marker or auxiliary fronting in main clause content questions, just fronting of an interrogative phrase and possibly a difference in intonation or tone or other non-syntactic marking

form.instruction: In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_prefix_V to these clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_suffix_V to these clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_prefix_V to the pro-clitics and add whQ_suffix_V to the post-clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_prefix to these clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_suffix to these clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, add the feature whQ_prefix to the pro-clitics and add whQ_suffix to the post-clitics. If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, if this word does not already have the category C, add the feature makeC to the feature line to change the category for the syntax. In either case, add the features question wh. Mark any Yes/No question markers with the feature -wh if they cannot occur in content questions . If a different marker is used in embedded questions, add the feature +root to this entry. If this same marker is used in embedded questions, do not add any root feature.

In the lexicon, mark those markers which can only occur initially with the feature CP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature CP-final. Do not enter either feature on any markers which can occur on either side.

In the lexicon, mark those markers which can only occur after the fronted interrogative phrase with the feature CP-initial and those which can only occur at the end of the question with the feature CP-final. Do not enter either feature on any markers which can occur in either position.
In the lexicon, mark each of the question markers which may occur before a fronted interrogative phrase with the feature CP-specifier-initial.
In the lexicon, mark those which may occur before a fronted interrogative phrase with the feature CP-specifier-initial. The others will default to - for that feature.
